author: sky.cactus
content: For the CL it will always land on `==`, but since slots can be empty sometimes the fork will happen on `>` for the EL.  By having the fork timestamp be an odd number, it ensures that it always triggers on `>` for both clients (fewer codepaths/confusion when the fork slot is missing a block).

author: ajsutton
content: But then it can’t be specified as an epoch which makes life much more complex. Better to just have >=. It’s easy to cover with a single test
